content.description: Vestal Virgin is actually an unfinished project with the top half done. The first pitch from the ground has yet to be done. I invite anyone to come out and finish it for me. It could take me a few more years to get'er done. The lower section looks to be 5.5-5.7 with some possible natural protection.
content.location: Scramble to the top of the Temple of Ishtar formation. Rappel to anchors.

content.description: Climbs the tallest water sculpted flute (Telephone Booth). Head left, out of the top of the fllue into a scoop, then up thru a bulge to lower angle rock and the anchor. The rock quality in the flute is kinda chossy but well protected and improves above.
content.location: Starts in the pit 10' to the left of Go Ask Alice, below a nice hang with benches.

content.description: Stick clip the high 1st bolt, or make the difficult moves to the 1st and continue up on stellar pockets and features until the angle eases. Above the bulge the line jogs right and climbs features and fewer pockets to the Mussy hook anchor.
content.location: Sixty feet left (downhill) from the "Korean Route." There is another route between the "Mad Hatter" and the "Korean Route," which is 5.10d/11a (just left of the water groove).

content.description: The initial moves are steep and involve pulling up on pockets and a large grainy inclusion. Continue working up and left on large pockets and rounded edges, which become less positive due to the left leaning nature of the route. Above the 3rd bolt the angle decreases, in a slabby section, before the final steep pocketed headwall. Continue up the headwall on pockets and small edges to the chain anchor.
content.location: Located on the south side of the Temple of Ishtar. 1st route on the right as you descend the ridge west of The Egg.

content.description: Pull a small overhang at the bottom on mostly friable crimps that will likely change every time someone climbs this. There is a big flake just left of the first bolt that is rapidly becoming less of a flake, although still a decent hold. Choss is the name of the game here. Eases up after the first 30 ft.
content.protection: 8 bolts to open shuts. There are also a set of chain anchors 1 more bolt above the open shuts that can be used for topping out.
content.location: Start at a clearing reinforced with wood. Climbs just left of the gully that has a big ole' boulder at the top. Fairly straight line.

content.description: Heart & Sole pulls the overhang, ten feet right (downhill) from the heart shaped depression. High step the shelf under the bulge while pulling a shallow scoop, to reach a match on a double headed knob and the 1st bolt. Continue up the face on pockets and knobs. Climb through the left side of a large reddish depression and pull the steep headwall on small pockets. Pull a final move on a slab to the anchor.
content.location: West face of Temple of Ishtar. Ten feet right of the heart shaped cavity, and twenty feet left (uphill) from the toe of the buttress.

content.description: "Heart" climbs into and through the large heart shaped depression that gives the "Heart Wall" it's name. Once established in the "Heart" pull a deep 3-finger pocket and poor crumbly inclusions to surmount the overhang and into a large, but shallow depression. Once established in the depression, clip the 2nd bolt, and continue up the steep wall on amazing pockets and knobs to the left side of a huge protruding block. Climb onto the block to reach the anchor.
content.location: Begin climbing up a large heart shaped cavity or depression.

content.description: Pull slab moves using small inset pebbles and cobbles, as well as, small pockets. Continue up the rounded buttress on large cobbles to the anchor below and left of a large white block.
content.protection: 11 bolts & 2-bolt anchor, not equipped for rappel, pulling the rope would be epic. Walk off to the north and down the gully to the south.
content.location: The west-most flank of the Temple of Ishtar. Right of Route 66, Onramp, and Mad Dog.

content.description:
Start up a chossy flake/ block to the first bolt. Set up and toss out left to a pocket. Start cranking moves between good pockets and more bolts up to a move to the right. On

slightly smaller holds turn the bulge on to lower angle rock and easier climbing to the anchor.
content.location: This route startsÂ down and left of Mad Hatter by 10'

content.description: This climb follows a left trending line that traverses to an anchor high on the west face of the Tower of Babel. Begin at the toe of the buttress pulling up into a large hueco by way of a fragile looking flake. Continue up the face on pockets and knobs past three maroon colorized bolt hangers. Move up and left to clip the 4th bolt of "Heart and Sole." Cross the water groove of "Cross Your Heart," clipping its 8th bolt. Continue traversing up and left clipping the 7th bolt of "Texas Two Step." The anchor is above up and to the left.
content.location: Begin at the toe of the buttress on the west face of the Temple of Ishtar.

content.description: Dixie climbs Deep in the Heart of Texas through the first two bolts with red/maroon hangers, then moves right under a very large white block to clip the 3rd bolt of Diixe and gain the broad arete . Continue up the featured and pockets face trending right to the anchors. The Dixie Variation may necessitate a long slings on the 2nd bolt or back cleaning to reduce rope drag.
content.location:
Right side of the Heart Wall.

Begin just uphill from the toe of the arete (5.8).

content.description: Start on the toe of the buttress on the right of the arete of Â Deep in the Heart of Â Texas.. Use a ramp to gain a good pocket which facilitates clipping the 1st bolt. Make delicate moves and heel hooking to gain the second bolt and cross the arete and up towards the 3rd bolt. From here, the route joins Heart of Dixie and is a fun slab fest ride to the anchors.
content.location: Technically on the south fast of Tower of Ishtar. Begin where there is a large inclusion with a pocket on the right. To the right of Heart of Dixie.

climbs.name: Deep in the Heart of Texas

content.description:
Deep in the Heart of Texas is a single pitch route with an extension. Pitch 1 (5.7) consists of 9 bolts to a two-chain anchor. The Extension contains two additional bolts leading to a pair of open shuts.

The bottom portion of the climb to the two-chain anchor is roughly 5.7 with a crux roughly halfway up the wall. The wall steepens at the two-chain anchor. From the ground to the extension is likely worthy of a 5.9 rating.
content.protection:
12 quickdraws from the ground to the extensionâs open shuts anchor. Or 9 quickdraws to the two-chain anchor located 3/4 of the way up the wall.

A 60-meter rope is sufficient to rappel the route down the fall line.

A 70-meter rope can be used to lower all the way to the ground from the extensionâs open shuts.

Regardless, donât forget to knot the end of your rope.
content.location: Located on the northwest corner of The Temple of Ishtar. The route is directly to the right of Heart and Sole.

content.description: Begin as for "Heart & Sole" with a high step on a shelf under the bulge, A difficult pull over the bulge leads to easier climbing on knobs. Clip the 2nd bolt (double runner), then traverse left through a large scoop or depression to clip "Hearts" 2nd bolt. Continue traversing left along the steep headwall to the base of the water course. Climb up the water course on pockets and knobs to an anchor on the left wall of the recess.
content.location: Begin as with Heart & Sole (10 ft. Right of the Heart), with a high step and a shallow scoop.
